Title: Load/stress testing .NET apps with Apache JMeter - Simple Talk
Description: Since Microsoft discontinued their cloud-based load testing services, developers need a new way to test applications. Julio Sampaio demonstrates how use one solution, JMeter.

Title: .NET Standard 1.3 is no longer supported in AWS SDK for .NET version 3.7 | Amazon Web Services
Description: Microsoft announced the end of support for .NET Core 1.0 and 1.1 platforms on June 27th, 2019. Following that, on May 18th, 2020, we announced the upcoming end-of-support for .NET Standard 1.3 in AWS SDK for .NET version 3. Yesterday we released version 3.7 of the AWS SDK for .NET which no longer supports .NET [‚Ä¶]

Title: New 5G protocol vulnerabilities allow location tracking | The Record by Recorded Future
Description: Security researchers have identified new vulnerabilities in the 5G protocol that could be abused to crash network segments and extract user data, such as location information.

Title: How Much of the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy Can You Fit on a QR Code?
Description:
I‚Äôve been dealing with QR codes recently, as one of my side projects generates them, and I got curious about how much data you can really fit in a QR code. Specifically, I wondered how much of my favorite book I could fit on one QR code.
QR Code versions QR Codes have different versions, but they‚Äôre not versions as you‚Äôd generally think about them, version in this case just means a particular size.

Title: Piano Practice Software Progress ¬∑ Jacques Mattheij
Description: First an apology. I started this project because during the first 9 months of the COVID-19 pandemic business was down to a fraction of what it was before then, and I had a lot of time on my hand. But that has changed now and there is a lot of work in my ‚Äòday job‚Äô, so I don‚Äôt have a whole lot of time to work on the piano software (or to play piano, for that matter). Even so I try to play at least an hour every day, just to unwind from the work, and while doing that I make notes of the things that I think should be improved.
